structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases
Actions For Death And Injuries Resulting In Death

law.catch_line: Insufficiency Of Estate To Pay Certain Expenses, Etc.; Preferences
law.text: All sums recovered under section one, two, two B or five A shall, if and to the extent that the assets of the estate of the deceased shall be insufficient to satisfy the same, be subject to the charges of administration and funeral expenses of said estate, to all medical and hospital expenses necessitated by the injury which caused the death, to reasonable attorneysâ€™ fees and reasonable costs and expenses of suit incurred in such recovery.
